sentences: Choi Soo-young (Korean: 최수영; born February 10, 1990), professionally known as Sooyoung, is a South Korean singer, actress and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: She was a member of the short-lived Korean-Japanese singing duo Route 0 during 2002 in Japan.
section: N/A

sentences: After returning to South Korea in 2004, Sooyoung eventually became a member of girl group Girls' Generation in 2007, which went on to become one of the best-selling artists in South Korea and one of South Korea's most popular girl groups worldwide.
section: N/A

sentences: Apart from her group's activities, Sooyoung has also starred in various television dramas such as The Third Hospital (2012), Dating Agency: Cyrano (2013), My Spring Days (2014), Squad 38 (2016), Man in the Kitchen (2017–2018), Tell Me What You Saw (2020), and most recently in Run On (2021)
section: N/A

sentences: and So I Married the Anti-fan (2021).
section: N/A

sentences: In October 2017, Sooyoung left SM Entertainment although she remains as a member of Girls' Generation.
section: N/A

sentences: She joined Echo Global Group and released her first solo single "Winter Breath" in 2018, before moving to Saram Entertainment in 2019.

sentences: Sooyoung was born in Gwangju, Gyeonggi, South Korea, on February 10, 1990.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She is the younger sister of Choi Soo-jin, who is a musical theatre actress.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sooyoung was initially discovered through an SM Entertainment Open Audition when she was in fifth grade.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She later won first place at the 2002 Korea-Japan Ultra Idol Duo Audition and debuted in Japan as a member of Route 0.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The duo released three singles before disbanding in 2003.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sooyoung returned to SM Entertainment and eventually debuted in South Korea as a member of the girl group Girls' Generation in August 2007.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The group gained significant popularity with the release of their hit single "Gee" in 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Sooyoung has said in an interview that she was also interested in acting before debuting as a singer and had failed more than 70 auditions during her pre-debut days.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2007: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Aside from Girls' Generation's activities, Sooyoung has participated in various music and acting projects.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In the early days, her acting work mostly involved several small roles and guest appearances—these include KBS2's sitcom Unstoppable Marriage (2007), romantic comedy film Hello, Schoolgirl (2008), SBS's drama Oh!
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: My Lady (2010), SBS's Paradise Ranch (2011) and SBS's A Gentleman's Dignity (2012).
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: During this period, musically, she recorded two songs—one trot song titled "KKok" with Girls' Generation member Yuri for the SBS' drama Working Mom, while the other one, "Feeling Only You", was a collaboration with Girls' Generation member Tiffany and South Korean duo The Blue.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: Throughout her career, besides contributing her vocal to Girls' Generation's songs, Sooyoung has explored into lyrics writing.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: She penned the lyrics for three songs: "How Great is Your Love" (2011), "What Do I Do" (2016), and "Sailing (0805)" (2016), while co-writing the song "Baby Maybe" (2013).
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In September 2012, she landed her first major acting role in tvN's medical drama The Third Hospital.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: She was praised by both co-actors Oh Ji Ho and Kim Seung-woo and the viewers were drawn to her emotional scene due to her natural display of emotion.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In May 2013, Sooyoung was cast in tvN's romantic comedy drama, Dating Agency: Cyrano.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: It was a spin-off of the 2010 movie Cyrano Agency.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: She played a dating expert who works at a dating agency helping people to find their love.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: Park Ju-yeon from the Hankook Ilbo praised Sooyoung for her lively character portrayal and said that there was not any "overdone emotions commonly appear in acting newcomers".
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In September 2014, Sooyoung scored a lead role in MBC's melodrama, My Spring Days.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: Her character is a terminally ill patient who gets a heart transplant; and meets her donor's husband, played by Kam Woo-sung.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: This was a breakthrough performance for Sooyoung as she won the "Best Actress in a Miniseries" award at the 2014 MBC Drama Awards and the "Excellence Award for Actress" at the 2015 Korea Drama Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: She contributed a song to its soundtrack, titled "Wind Flower".
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In 2015, Sooyoung starred as the female lead in KBS2's special drama Perfect Sense, which was produced by Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance to help raise public understanding of the disabled.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: She played a teacher named Ah-yeon who is visually impaired.
section: == Life and career == | === 2008–2016: Acting roles and lyrics writing ===

sentences: In June 2016, Sooyoung starred as the female lead alongside Ma Dong-seok and Seo In-guk in the OCN crime drama Squad 38.

sentences: In early August 2017, Sooyoung starred as television producer in the JTBC web drama Someone You Might Know.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: Later in August, she played the female lead in the MBC drama series Man in the Kitchen.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In November 2017, Sooyoung joined Echo Global Group after her contract with SM Entertainment ended.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: With a change of label, her future activities with Girls' Generation remain in discussion.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In 2018, Sooyoung was cast in the Korean-Japanese film Memories of a Dead End, the action comedy film Girl Cops, and the romantic comedy television series So I Married the Anti-fan, based on the manhwa of the same name, alongside Choi Tae-joon.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In December 2018, Sooyoung released her solo single, "Winter Breath," which is her first song to be released since her departure from SM Entertainment, with the song's music video made available online on the same day.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: Sooyoung launched her official Twitter and YouTube accounts to commemorate the single's release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In May 2019, Sooyoung signed with new agency Saram Entertainment.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In February 2020, Sooyoung starred in the OCN drama Tell Me What You Saw.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: In 2020–2021, Sooyoung starred in JTBC’s romance drama Run On.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Label change and continued acting ===

sentences: On April 30, 2021, Korean media reported that Sooyoung will appear in the Netflix original series "Move to Heaven: I am a relic organizer"

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Since 2015, Sooyoung has held an annual charity auction event called "Beaming Effect", to raise money for finding a cure for retinitis pigmentosa, a disease that her father suffers from.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Sooyoung graduated from JeongShin Women's High School in 2009.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She went on to major in film studies and graduated from Chung-Ang University in February 2016, receiving a lifetime achievement award at the graduation ceremony.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Her fellow Girls' Generation member Kwon Yuri attended the same university.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Sooyoung has been dating Jung Kyung-ho since 2013.
